register module¶

Methods used for image registration.

stabilize2p.register.ECC_transform(video: numpy.ndarray, nb_iters=5, eps=1e-06) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Affine alignment using cv2.findTransformECC().

>4 times faster than pystackreg’s translation transform.

stabilize2p.register.com_transform(video: numpy.ndarray, inplace=False, downsample=2, target=None) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Fast translation alignment of frames based on the Center of Mass.

This method is not very precise. >40 times faster than pystackreg’s translation transform.

Parameters

  • video (array) – input to align

  • inplace (bool) – whether to modify the input video instead of making a copy. Default is False

  • downsample (int) –

    integer factor by which to downscale the frames when calculating the CoM and background threshold.

    Default is 2. This improves performance at a very low cost on accuracy

  • target (array) – Pixel point target that CoMs must arrive to (must be positive). Defaut is None, which means that target is calculated as the mean of the CoMs of the frames of video

Returns

copy of the input video (or input video if inplace is True), with the translation transform applied

Return type

array

stabilize2p.register.pysreg_transform(video: numpy.ndarray, method=6, reference='first') → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Apply pystackreg.StackReg to video.

stabilize2p
